javadoc.text:
*
This class represents a logarithmic converter. Such converter * is typically used to create logarithmic unit. For example:[code] * Unit BEL = Unit.ONE.transform(new LogConverter(10).inverse()); * [/code] *
Instances of this class are immutable.
* Holds the natural logarithm of the base.
* Holds the inverse of the natural logarithm of the base.
* Holds the inverse of this converter.
* Creates a logarithmic converter having the specified base.
javadoc.param: base the logarithmic base (e.g. Math.E for * the Natural Logarithm).

javadoc.text: * Returns the logarithmic base of this converter.
javadoc.return: the logarithmic base (e.g. Math.E for * the Natural Logarithm).

javadoc.text: * This inner class represents the inverse of the logarithmic converter * (exponentiation converter).
